1 (function($NS){
  2 	var utils = $NS.patternUtils,
  3 		Class = $NS.Class;
  4 	
  5 	/**
  6 	 * Function initializes the singleton
  7 	 * and returns object which can fetch the 
  8 	 * singleton instance.
  9 	 * @private
 10      * @param {Function} Construct
 11 	 */
 12 	function Singleton(Construct){
 13 		var instance = new Construct();
 14 		
 15 		this.getInstance = function(){
 16 			return instance;
 17 		};
 18 	}
 19 	
 20 	/**
 21 	 * Singleton definition is used to create objects which should be 
 22 	 * initialized only once and exists during entire application flow.
 23 	 * @class
 24 	 * @name py.Singleton
 25 	 * 
 26 	 * @example
 27 	 * py.Singleton('loader', {
 28 	 *     construct: function(){
 29 	 *         //some initialization code here
 30 	 *     },
 31 	 *     load: function(){
 32 	 *         //some loding implementation    
 33 	 *     }
 34 	 * },'app');
 35 	 * 
 36 	 * var loaderInstance = app.loader.getInstance();
 37 	 * loaderInstance.load();
 38 	 * 
 39 	 * @constructor
 40      * @param {String} name
 41      * @param {IDefinition} definition
 42      * @param {String | Object} pckg
 43 	 */
 44 	function SingletonCreator(name, definition, pckg){
 45 		var singleton;
 46 		Class.prototype.validateInput(name, definition, pckg);
 47 		singleton = new Singleton($NS.Class(name, definition, {}));
 48 		Class.prototype.applyToPackage(pckg, singleton, name);
 49 		return singleton;
 50 	}
 51 	
 52 	SingletonCreator.prototype = {
 53 		Singleton: Singleton
 54 	};
 55 	
 56 	$NS.Singleton = SingletonCreator;
 57 	
 58 }(patternity));
 59
